intro: Miconia teysmanniana, commonly known as the Hawaiian miconia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific, including Hawaii. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an understory tree or shrub in moist, shaded forest environments. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are dispersed by birds and other animals. Due to its rapid growth and invasive potential, it is considered a problematic species in some regions.
